name: Sole à la Fermière
recipeInstructions: 1. Grease an oval flameproof dish, and add the shallot, 60 g mushrooms, parsley, thyme and a bay leaf.
2. Lay the sole on top, pour in the wine and season.
3. Cover, and cook gently on the hob until the sole is cooked.
4. Slice the remaining mushrooms and cook in 30 g butter, tossing the so they are golden brown, but still firm.
5. Arrange the mushrooms around the edge off an oval dish and place the cooked sole in the center.
6. Boil down the sauce by half.

7. Mash the flour with an equal amount of butter to make a beurre manié and add it to the sauce in pieces. When the sauce is ready, whisk in the remaining butter off the heat, and strain it over the fish.
8. Lightly brown under a hot grill.
